title: error updating smallvec in rustc

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I'm trying to update rust-lang/rust to the latest smallvec (0.6.7 ➙ 0.6.9), and an running into an issue where rustc fails to compile: > error: internal compiler error: src/librustc/ty/relate.rs:773: impossible case reached: can't relate: '_#0r with Type(RustaceansAreAwesome) I have narrowed down the change that breaks this to https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/pull/137. I don't know anything about smallvec and very little about rustc, so if anyone can help figure out what's wrong, I'd appreciate it. I'll keep digging a little, but it is unlikely that I'll be able to do more. This can be reproduced with `cargo update -p smallvec; ./x.py build` (on master, acda261de83475cf6cbc607d570153bb864ee7be).
